citations.narrative:
On April 5, 2024 a parakeet was stepped on and died. The facility has an aviary with approximately 150 parakeets in free
flight. Guests are allowed to enter to feed the parakeets a seed mixture from their hands. During feeding, some seed falls
on the ground and the birds land on the ground to get the seed. Guests are instructed to shuffle their feet or sit to reduce
risk of stepping on a bird but in this incident, a small child was sitting on a bench and their feet could not reach the
ground. When the child hopped to the ground, they landed on a bird, killing it. Care must be taken so that there is minimal
risk of harm to the birds during public exhibition. The facility must take measures to ensure safe handling with sufficient
distance and/or barriers between the birds and the general viewing public to assure the health and safety of all animals.
Correct by 8/25/24.

On May 1, 2024, a parakeet was found deceased, entangled in the unraveled rope of an enrichment toy. The toy was a
combination of wooden blocks and rope/twine that had been chewed to the point of unwinding. The bird was found
entangled and deceased by an employee. It is important to remove worn and broken furnishings and enrichment items to
prevent injury and death. Furniture-type objects and other objects that enrich a bird's environment, must be species-
appropriate and be designed, constructed, and maintained so as to prevent harm to the bird. Corrected prior to the time of
inspection on 8/15/24.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with facility managers.
